Played it right after playing the first Portal.

maybe because the first one was a bit short,
didn't expect this one to be so much longer.

In many aspects, it has become much better
: graphics, obstacles, story, etc.

Some stages can be overly frustrating but hold one
because the ending is worth it.

This game is perfect, from the story, to the community aspects of this game. Detail everywhere.

THE STORY:
If you have played portal 1, then you know that it takes place in a testing facillit, (The one from the first game). In the facillity they test their product; The portal gun. This portal gun can shoot two portals at selected types of walls called portalable walls. With this portal gun, you get guided through the first part of the game by a little robot called Wheatly. Wheatly eventually asks you to give him the power over the facillity. After doeing so, he will become thirsty for power. He isn't running the place good, even so bad that the intire facillity almost get's comepletely destroyed. You and the previous villan go out of you ways to find and stop Wheatly. This isn't easy, as you have to pass through old test chamber left overs to do so. These test chambers each have puzzles in them. Difficulty will vary upon the chambers. After finnaly completing the most clever and fun test chambers and tests, you and GlaDos, The previous villan, go ahead and try to add other cores to Wheatly. Hoping this will conclude in fainting him or him losing control due to stress. Eventually he will try to blow you up, sooo... YOU GO TO SPAAAACE!!! (You fire a portal at the moon(wich is for some reason portalable) and you, Wheatly and GlaDos get teleported to the moon. you and GlaDos escape but Wheatly is doomed to stay in space forever...

Best storyline game i've ever played... Best puzzles i've ever seen...                                                                        Game: 9.4         


COMMUNITY:
There is a complete testing chamber edditor. This easy to use editor will give you acces to almost all the elements in portal, such as cubes, goo and turrets... With this you can make AMAZING test chambers in this game. Just lay one eye on the community page. You'll see how many great chambers people have made; Truely amazing.

Best community i've seen in quite a while... Nice community test chambers...                 Communnity Impact on game: 9.6


Conclustion: Buy this game, it's a fun experience and a great puzzle game.

Favourite quote out of the game: Hello? Are you still there?

This game, is a really damn good puzzle game. I'll be honest, I never got around to finishing it, because it reached a point where I simply couldn't figure out the puzzles anymore. The puzzles themselves are great, and make you utilize many game mechanics in order to complete them. There's an interesting plot to Portal as well, and this game revolves allot more around story than the first one, and is allot longer too. If you really like puzzle games and think you're smart enough, go ahead and get it, if not, don't or you're gonna end up torturing yourself lol.

Es raro encontrar una secuela que sea mejor que el juego original, sin embargo este es uno de esos casos. No estoy diciendo que el Portal original sea un mal juego, para nada, es un juegazo que tienes que tener en tu biblioteca pero Portal 2 es una joyita. Mejor jugabilidad, muchos mas niveles y un buen desarrollo de la historia de Portal y Aperture Laboratories con grandes giros argumentativos, ademas del modo cooperativo online y local. No dudes en comprarlo, es un clasico.

Jeu vraimant génial.

A acheter absolument si vous aimez les jeux de puzzle.

Portal 2, c'est un jeu à avoir dans sa bibliothèque Steam à tout prix ! (Surtout quand il est seulement à 1,99€ pendant les soldes)

Solo intéressant (mais toujours pas fini tellement mon cerveau brûle) tout comme la coopération (à condition d'avoir des amis). Pour l'instant, je ne regrette pas mon achat tellement le jeu est amusant. 

Attention néanmoins, comme dit précédemment, cela peut provoquer des douleurs importantes au cerveaux, faites attention :)

[h1] You changed me forever [/h1]
Oh hello there... i was not ready for this.
You know,i thought they were all stories made up by our ancestors,tales of old people that believed in the presence of magic and multiple gods that ruled our world... didn't expect to see some of these stories to be actually true.
I didn't believe a lot in these magical stuff,but now that i see it with my eyes,i can only say that i was wrong.
I have never seen a magical creature like [b]you[/b],I never expected to meet one.

People that didn't buy Portal 2 actually exist,[b]YOU EXIST[/b],and now i'm afraid of what i thought was possible and what was not.

[h1]The best puzzle game[/h1]
It's another masterpiece that improves upon the original in all of the most important ways. Graphics, story, mechanics, multiplayer, Steam Workshop levels... It's perfect. You even flip faster when coming out of a portal upside down.

Unfortunately for local split screen co-op:
[list]
[*]You can't play community chambers.
[*]Playing with mouse/keyboard and 1 controller requires console use.
[*]The campaign doesn't reward the achievements.
[/list]
